alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; LAZ049; LAZ050; LAZ072; LAZ075; Northern Tangipahoa; Southeast St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 05 at 11:33AM CDT until April 13 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches with locally higher totals may occur. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and Mississippi, including the following counties and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, Ascension, East Baton Rouge, Iberville, Livingston, Northern Tangipahoa, Northwest St. Tammany, Southeast St. Tammany, Southern Tangipahoa, St. Helena, Washington and West Baton Rouge. In Mississippi, Hancock, Harrison, Jackson and Pearl River. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; LAZ049; LAZ050; LAZ072; LAZ075; Northern Tangipahoa; Southeast St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington; West Baton Rouge
